TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Matrix44 extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The Matrix44 class holds a 4x4 matrix for transforming coordinates.

remarks.para: The Matrix44 class holds a 4x4 matrix for transforming coordinates. It is similar to Matrix, and should be used when you want to manipulate the canvas in 3D. Values are kept in row-major order. The values and operations are treated as column vectors.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: The default Matrix44 constructor will instantiate an identity matrix.

remarks.para: The default Matrix44 constructor will instantiate an identity matrix.

MemberSignature.Value: public Matrix44 (Android.Graphics.Matrix mat);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Android.Graphics.Matrix mat) cil managed
new Android.Graphics.Matrix44 : Android.Graphics.Matrix -> Android.Graphics.Matrix44

Docs.param: A 3x3 Matrix to be converted (original Matrix will not be changed)
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a Matrix44 by taking the 3x3 Matrix and placing it on the 0 of the z-axis by setting row 2 and column 2 to the identity as seen in the following operation:

remarks.para: Creates and returns a Matrix44 by taking the 3x3 Matrix and placing it on the 0 of the z-axis by setting row 2 and column 2 to the identity as seen in the following operation:
remarks.code: [ a b c ] [ a b 0 c ] [ d e f ] -> [ d e 0 f ] [ g h i ] [ 0 0 1 0 ] [ g h 0 i ]
remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The second Matrix in the concatenation operation
Docs.summary: Multiplies `this` matrix (A) and provided Matrix (B) in the order of A * B.
Docs.returns: A reference to this Matrix, which can be used to chain Matrix operations

remarks.para: Multiplies `this` matrix (A) and provided Matrix (B) in the order of A * B. The result is saved in `this` Matrix.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float32[] Map(float32 x, float32 y, float32 z, float32 w) cil managed
abstract member Map : single * single * single * single -> single[] override this.Map : single * single * single * single -> single[]

Docs.summary: Multiplies (x, y, z, w) vector by the Matrix44, then returns the new (x, y, z, w).
Docs.returns: An array of length 4 that represents the x, y, z, w (where w is perspective) value after multiplying x, y, z, 1 by the matrix

remarks.para: Multiplies (x, y, z, w) vector by the Matrix44, then returns the new (x, y, z, w). Users should set w to 1 to indicate the coordinates are normalized.

format.a: Java documentation for android.graphics.Matrix44.map(float, float, float, float).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: Amount in degrees to rotate the matrix about the x-axis
X component of the rotation axis
Y component of the rotation axis
Z component of the rotation axis
Docs.summary: Applies a rotation around a given axis, then returns self.
Docs.returns: A reference to this Matrix, which can be used to chain Matrix operations

remarks.para: Applies a rotation around a given axis, then returns self. x, y, z represent the axis by which to rotate around. For example, pass in 1, 0, 0 to rotate around the x-axis. The axis provided will be normalized.

format.a: Java documentation for android.graphics.Matrix44.rotate(float, float, float, float).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
